news.headline: IRS Tax-Filing Pilot Opens Wide, With Aim of 100,000 First-Year Users
news.summary: WASHINGTON—The Internal Revenue Service’s new free online tax-filing system has already been used by 15,000 taxpayers, and administration officials hope it will reach 100,000 this year as they consider future expansions.  The system—IRS Direct File—is now open round-the-clock to all eligible taxpayers after a narrower pilot phase that started earlier this year with selected government employees.  It is still available only to households with relatively simple tax returns in 12 states; the 15,000 figure includes people who have started returns but not finished them yet.
